intro: Agrostemma corsicum, commonly known as Corsican goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its seeds are small and enclosed in a hard capsule. Agrostemma corsicum is considered a minor weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
